definitions: To place something over or in front of (something else) so as to protect, conceal, or close it.
To deal with (a subject) by describing or analyzing it.
To provide with enough money to pay for something.
To aim a gun at someone or something.
examples: The ground was covered in snow.
The report covered various aspects of the economy.
They covered a lot of ground on their trip.
Does your insurance cover dental work?
The police officer covered the suspect.
